result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L. Petroski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Fulltime employment, schooling, or a combination of the two.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
AMENDED
21 days credit if revoked.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda L. Petroski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:42 pm 
INCLUDES 16CF1090, 15CF490, AND 14CF681. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty John Bachman. 
VRCW. 

PLEA HEARING IN 16CF1090. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.
State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 3 (Possess Illegally Obtained Prescription)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: Ct. 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through with recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with advanced agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit. 

MOTION TO REVOKE DEOJ IN 14CF681. 
State moves to revoke DEOJ agreement on Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine). 
COURT grants and enters judgment of conviction on Ct. 1. 
COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: 30 days MCJ; AODA and follow through with recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with advanced agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def entitled to 21 days jail credit. 

SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 14CF681 AND 15CF490. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 14CF681: Ct. 2>>90 days MCJ with 121 days jail credit. 
In 15CF490: Ct. 3>>9 months MCJ with 100 days jail credit. 
COURT ORDERS unpaid costs converted to civil judgment. 

COURT ORDERS ALL JAIL SENTENCES TO RUN CONCURRENT. 

Adj: 2:57 pm

In 15CF490: Ct. 3>>SWH for 1 year probation - CONDTIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; DNA sample and surcharge; CC.
